[b][color=white]Discovered Fossilized Footprints Challenge Aspects of Evolution[/color][/b] 
As far as footprints go, humans have fairly distinctive ones compared to other mammals. They also differ from that of our lesser evolved brethren. This newly discovered fossilized footprint makes us reconsider much of what we previously thought about the early stages of human evolution. The fossil, found in Crete, is younger than the oldest known fossil hominin. Until the dawn of this year, all of our previous discoveries of this specific species have originated in Africa. This predates prior findings by approximately 5.3 million years. This heavily challenges the notion of Africa being the birthplace of modern humans. According to Per Ahlberg "This discovery challenges the established narrative of early human evolution head-on and is likely to generate a lot of debate. Whether the human origins research community will accept fossil footprints as conclusive evidence of the presence of hominins in the Miocene of Crete remains to be seen." There are also pictures of these fossilized footprints at the bottom of the source article should you want to have a peek at them.
[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.uu.se/en/media/press-releases/press-release/?id=3982&area=3,8&typ=pm&lang=en]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]First Sugar tax in Mexico Cuts Into Soda Sales[/color][/b] 
I may be hugely in the minority here, but I am someone that doesn't drink soda at all. Thus when I come across an article such as this one which is mainly about people substituting highly sugared beverages for water, I have no choice but to talk about it. In January 2014 Mexico put a tax on all sugar sweetened beverages sold within the country, as a way to combat the country's problems with rampant obesity. According to a study in the Journal of Nutrition, sales of soft drinks fell around 6% while the sales of water increased. The World Health Organization is calling for taxes like this to be implemented across the globe to fight the scourge of diabetes and obesity. Would you be opposed to something like this?  [i][size=x-small][url=https://saludmovil.com/first-sugar-tax-in-mexico-cuts-soft-drink-sales-by-6/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

    
[/size][/font]

[b][color=white]Here is When Microsoft's Next Big Windows Update Will Come[/color][/b]
Microsoft has declared that a noteworthy refresh to its Windows OS will be discharged universally on October 17. The arrival of Windows 10 "Fall Creators Update" will come on the day that Windows Mixed Reality headsets controlled by the product hit the market, Microsoft official VP of working frameworks Terry Myerson said in a blog entry. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gadgetsnow.com/tech-news/heres-when-microsofts-next-big-windows-update-will-come/articleshow/60336987.cms]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]iPhone 8 Could Be Called iPhone Edition[/color][/b]
It has been known since long that Apple will dispatch three iPhones in 2017 - two models with incremental moves up to the iPhone 7 and 7 Plus, which came to be supposed as the iPhone 7S and iPhone 7S Plus and one new model with OLED show and all the most recent tech, known as the iPhone 8. 
Be that as it may, another report from 9to5Mac says the tenth commemoration version will be referred to as the iPhone Edition. While iPhone 8 is not the ceremony version, but rather what everybody called the iPhone 7S, the greater variation would be known as the iPhone 8 Plus. The report depends on intel originating from Foxconn processing plants and uncovered by case-makers who have renamed the SKUs in agreement to the terminology. [i][size=x-small][url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/technology/story/leak-confirms-new-iphone-could-be-called-the-iphone-edition/1/1039298.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

      
[/size][/font]
[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews/Tsundere.png[/img][/align]
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=xx-small]

[b][color=white]Wild West Online Alpha Testing Will Begin in September[/color][/b] 
The first thing that comes to mind for most gamers when discussing wild west games is Red Dead Redemption. This game right here is not that, but it might take the world by storm. Wild West Online is an upcoming open-world MMO where you get to play as a cowboy and roam the wild west. That may sound boring to you, but in the game, you will have the ability to do possibly more than you were able to in Red Dead Redemption. You have the ability to own your farm and gather crops to earn gold, treasure hunt, and even pan for gold. It sounds like the main motive in this game is to make the most money that you can and beat other players with the items you purchase. A little bit of a GTA online system, right? In September a group of people will be selected to play the alpha version of the game. When it is in alpha, the game will have a limited amount of people on it. You may be wondering then, "what's the point?!" Well, the open alpha will be open to the world in October. Then, you will have the chance to play with others worldwide. Both betas will be open for a good amount of time for you to enjoy the game. Lastly, soon after the open alpha, a closed beta will be hosted. How to get access to the closed beta has not been disclosed yet. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/wild-west-online-alpha-testing-will-begin-in-september/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Sonic Forces Bonus Edition Includes Persona 5, Jet Set Radio Outfits For Your Custom Hedgehog[/color][/b] 
Sonic Mania was released earlier this month. Coming soon is Sonic Forces which will be released early September. If you are a huge Sonic fan, then there is a little something extra that you can purchase with your Sonic Mania game. A special physical edition will be released that contains awesome bonus items. You can purchase the special edition right now (pre-order) for $40/£45. Once purchased, you will be receiving four art cards, four outfits for different characters within the game, and even a custom controller or joy-con with the Sonic Mania theme. What makes this Sonic unique game compared to the other versions is the fact that you can now customize your characters with different appearances. So purchasing the bonus addition to get these awesome new clothing will spice up your 'fit. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sonic-forces-bonus-edition-includes-persona-5-jet-/1100-6453034/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]The Internet Won't Stop Talking About This Street Fighter Character's Walk[/color][/b] 
If you are a fan of fine legs, then you should check out this beauty from Street Fighter V. The game has been out since February of last year, and if you are a fan of fighting games, you are probably still duking it out with others in the world. Recently on August 29 was the release of a DLC pack for the game. Included were new outfits for characters as well as a new fighter, Menat. What makes her very special is the way that she walks. Talked about all over Facebook, Twitter, and even Instagram, Menat has the strut that will keep your eyes glued to the screen. To take a look at this sexy diva, click [url=https://twitter.com/Kobra_47/status/902635370751434755?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw&ref_url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fortressofsolitude.co.za%2Fstreet-fighter-v-menat-walk%2F]here[/url]. More about the character is that Menat is an apprentice of a very well known Italian fortune teller. Her fighting abilities allow her to use magic, which also allows her to strike from a distance. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.fortressofsolitude.co.za/street-fighter-v-menat-walk/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[/size][/font]
